let and const declarations define variables that are scoped to the running execution contextâ€™s LexicalEnvironment. The variables are created when their containing Lexical Environment is instantiated but may not be accessed in any way until the variableâ€™s LexicalBinding is evaluated. A variable defined by a LexicalBinding with an Initializer is assigned the value of its Initializerâ€™s AssignmentExpression when the LexicalBinding is evaluated, not when the variable is created.
